sub_title: Research, evaluation and facilitation in culture, heritage and international collaboration
summary:
🎯Driven by the value of culture and creativity as a driver for social change.
__

Working part time for Europeana Foundation, with part-time availability for other consultancy assignments. Please reach out if you'd like to discuss a project or activity that I can support you with.
__

Cultural researcher, evaluator, facilitator, advisor and project manager based in the The Hague, the Netherlands, with experience of working internationally (UK, Europe, Sri Lanka and Russia) and remotely (Iran, Western Balkans, Morrocco). 

Worked or delivered assignments for diverse stakeholders including Europeana Foundation, Arts Council England, PRS for Music Foundation, Waag, DG INTPA, DG EAC, British Council, Voices of Culture, UNESCO, InterArts, culture Solutions. 

Resourceful and reflective, a driven and confident communicator with proven ability to effectively manage complex remote projects and networks with multi-national teams and diverse stakeholders. 

Runner, cyclist and bike-packer, hiker, traveller, all-round fan of the outdoors, learning Dutch and Russian. A lapsed trombonist with a love of music and the power of music to change lives.

treasury_media.title: Evaluation report of Women Make Music, PRS Foundation (UK)
treasury_media.description:
Together with UK-based researcher Olivia Gable, we evaluated the 10 year impact of the fund, collecting primary data via digital questionnaires, interviews and focus groups, and analysing application data and evaluation forms. Following a literature review, we set out 10 key challenges facing women and gender expansive music creators. 

For more information, see https://prsfoundation.com/funding-support/funding-music-creators/all-career-levels/women-make-music-2/women-make-music-10-year-report/

treasury_media.title: A review of digital transformation tools and digital maturity paradigms - Mingei project
Publication on digital approaches in European Capitals of Culture
treasury_media.description:
Drawing from training delivered for the Capacity Building Project for ECOCs, together with Anne Kurzweg (Chemnitz) we set out key learnings in five areas: 
1. Building (hybrid) communities that last
2. Opportunities in digital and hybrid creative programming,
3. ECOCs on digital platforms and in transmedia story-telling
4. Using evaluation and open data for public engagement
5. Exploring digital tools for project management

treasury_media.title: The Russian independent cultural sector and the war in Ukraine — ArtyGeneration
treasury_media.description: We share how we can support Ukraine, consider the dangers of cultural isolation, acknowledge the power of creative resistance, and commit to maintaining dialogue with the Russian independent sector, starting with our survey

treasury_media.title: Nicole McNeilly - Center for Music Ecosystems - music ecosystems builders
treasury_media.description: A profile on the Center for Music Ecosystems webpage

treasury_media.title: Understanding Europeana’s impact - introducing our impact assessment reports | Europeana Pro
treasury_media.description: Read more about Europeana's first batch of eight Impact Assessment reports and what we learned from the process.

treasury_media.title: Defining digital transformation for the cultural heritage sector | Europeana Pro
treasury_media.description: ‘Digital transformation’ is a term that is used in different ways by different people in different sectors. We have worked with our peers, partners and Europeana Network Association members to agree a common working definition that is relevant to the cultural heritage sector and our stakeholders.

treasury_media.description: We've compiled the most comprehensive list of artist residencies across Russia for both internationals and locals.

projects.title: Digital music heritage and cultural diplomacy project - EUNIC Moscow
projects.description:
Building on Europe’s rich cultural heritage, and capitalising on the 2018 European Year of Cultural Heritage, the EUNIC Moscow cluster, in collaboration with Nicole McNeilly, Alfa Fellow 2018/2019, have developed a music heritage cultural diplomacy project to help Europe’s music heritage reach new audiences across Russia (and Europe and the rest of the world). 

Europe’s national heritage organisations are active digitizers, collaborators and promoters of their national treasures. The digitised music treasures of Europe’s heritage institutions are rich resources that we propose to take to audiences outside of Europe (beginning with Russia) to promote an understanding of the variety and diversity - and value - of Europe’s heritage and history. 

The project asks heritage institutions to recommend a piece of music and to provide a short introduction to the work. Each contribution (we aim for at least 10 EU countries to be represented) should present an internationally lesser-known national composer. The piece of music (score and parts) should be available digitally and available in the public domain or with a copyright license that allows free reuse. The piece should ideally be for an orchestral ensemble or other classical ensemble, e.g. choir or chamber group. The introduction to the work should outline information about the composer and socio-historical context, allowing audiences (including educators) to benefit from the institution’s expertise (e.g. using this information to develop learning resources or programme notes).

The collected works will be made available on a website that is designed for its target country. The website will be promoted with local partners, including conservatoires, commercial partners and networks of music educators and ensembles. Participation and performance of the music will be incentivised through a digital campaign.

profile_positions.description:
➡️ Project evaluation and impact assessment (specialising in impact approaches, developing evaluation and impact assessment plans)
➡️ Researcher and evaluator for cultural and creative industries organisations. 

Past projects (see also those conducted through culture Solutions):
✔️Evaluator of the Doubling Disability programme, Creative Diversity Network (UK) (Nov 2022).
✔️Moderator of three Voices of Culture breakout brainstorming groups (2021-2022). Lead writer of 2022 report on International Cultural Relations and policy brief presented to EC representatives.
✔️Facilitator and trainer, Academy Camp on Digital Approaches in ECOCs, InterArts/Capacity Building for ECOCs (Chemnitz2025).
✔️ Co-authored (with Professor Marilena Vecco, BSB) a paper for a European Commission-organised workshop for Member State representatives on culture and social cohesion, focussing on the role of culture as means for confidence-building and empowerment to (re-)enter the job market (Nov 2020).
✔️ Evaluator, Perceptions heritage and gender representation programme in the Western Balkans (July – August 2019). British Council.
✔️ Advisor on cultural development for the Russian Arctic North - developed holistic cultural development plan and case study for Russian NGO Сотрудничество, cultural centre ‘The Second School’ and Russian metals and mining company Norilsk Nickel (March – April 2019).
✔️ Cultural and creative spillovers in Europe – commissioned to write an evidence review for the European Research Partnership on Cultural and Creative Spillovers. Published December 2018.
✔️ Evaluator of the ‘pop-up studios’ project, Marrakesh, Morocco - produced a report and recommendations for furthering a bilateral partnership with Northern Ireland (British Council, June – August 2014).
✔️ Global audit of national youth orchestras, El Sistema and Sistema-inspired initiatives, and Youth Orchestra networks, assistant researcher (British Council (through Hawthorns Consulting Ltd) May 2012).
profile_positions.title: International research, evaluation and impact assessment consultant

profile_positions.description:
I work to further Europeana's work on creating a shared narrative about the impact of digital cultural heritage. Strategically, this includes furthering how we think about, support and measure digital transformation; leading the development of a Europeana Initiative Theory of Change; generating evidence that helps us create more impact for our stakeholders; and embedding learning and good practice around impact across the Europeana Initiative. 

Practically, this includes collaboratively developing Phases three and four of the Europeana Impact Playbook, reviewing and iterating Phases one and two, and delivering online events for the Europeana Impact Community and wider sector. I conduct impact assessments and coach others in the process. This includes developing resources like data collection sheets and a standardised question bank to better support the cultural heritage sector to start collecting data that might help us better understand their impact in society and to monitor and accelerate their digital transformation.
profile_positions.title: Impact Advisor

profile_positions.description: Guiding the development of 10 impact assessment frameworks, to evidence the value of Europeana's core services to the cultural heritage sector and wider European public. Delivered a report (July 2020) for the European Commission synthesising the findings.
profile_positions.title: Impact Assessment Consultant

profile_positions.description:
✔️Senior expert for the synthesis of main messages and key-takings from Africa-Europe Week 2022 and EABF 2022 events (DG INTPA).
✔️Lead advisor (April - May 2021) on knowledge dissemination at UNESCO digital two-day conference on cash for work in heritage crisis programme in Yemen. Moderator of the panel on the potential of CCIs in development (culture Solutions assignment).
✔️Project lead for the development of knowledge-sharing strategy for EUDELs responsible for culture (DG INTPA G3 Culture Team).
✔️Project lead for the development and delivery of a three-day training programme on behalf of DEVCO for EU delegation colleagues responsible for culture in external relations (February 2021).
Member of the research team, contributed to inaugural research report 'Composing Trust' published Spring 2020.
✔️Coordinator (September 2020 - December 2021) of the training and know-how internal group.
profile_positions.title: Collaborator

profile_positions.description: ArtyGeneration profiles Russia's most interesting creators and disruptors. With collaborators based in Russia and the European Union, we are creating a platform that gives a unique insight into Russia's creative scene, with content ranging from in-depth research to cultural commentary and from interviews to mapping the future artists of creative Russia.
profile_positions.title: Cultural writer and researcher

profile_positions.description:
Joining in the last year of this Horizon 2020 project, I was responsible for the delivery of the workpackage on impact evaluation, which involved: 
- coaching heritage partners using the Team-Based Inquiry research and evaluation methodology 
- conducting a Team-Based Inquiry cycle on the research question - 'what makes impactful communication and dissemination?' internally in Waag
- delivering a wide range of communications content for publication
- moderating a successful public seminar (Mingei Day, March 2022)
- editing existing deliverables into an appropriate format for wide dissemination 
- designing the final impact evaluation strategy
- conducting primary research with project partners
- coordinating the completion of the final deliverable, including working with technical partners in terms of their content additions and writing much of the deliverable based on impact evaluation approach taken
- conducting a review of digital transformation self-assessment tools and digital maturity paradigms
- preparing and supporting the presentation of the impact work package at the review meeting (June 2022)
profile_positions.title: Impact evaluation adviser - Mingei

profile_positions.description: Delivered the multiple stakeholder evaluation of the UK-Russia Year of Music. Tracked three cohorts across the Years, and combined with an ambitious interview programme, resulted in the perspectives of 45 individuals captured directly by the evaluation team in interview. Developed surveys (in Russian and in English) for professional (music sector) events audiences, general public, digital (social media and website) audiences, etc. 1,300+ survey responses were captured.
profile_positions.title: Evaluation Consultant

profile_positions.description: External Quality Expert providing additional evaluation support from a digital heritage specialism to Erasmus+ funded CrowdDreaming: youths co-create Digital Culture (CDDC) project.
profile_positions.title: External Quality Expert

company.name: Cultural and Education Section of the British Embassy, Moscow / British Council

profile_positions.company: Cultural and Education Section of the British Embassy, Moscow / British Council
profile_positions.description:
Consultant to the UK-Russia Year of Music 2019 (£1.5m cultural diplomacy programme), supporting the Moscow-based team and working collaboratively with colleagues from multiple British Council offices. 

Programme evaluation 
Developing the programme evaluation framework including logic modelling and creation of outcomes framework in accordance with existing monitoring and evaluation requirements (REF); identification of key audiences and development of programme sub-objectives and success indicators; identifying opportunities for and embedding data collection amongst teams across different sites.

Programme support
Development of brief for bilateral UK-Russia residency programme with external agency, RUSH Initiative; supporting development of grants programme criteria. 

Funding and governance
Working with country director on (successful) funding bid for >£500,000. Improving decision-making processes by formalising weekly minute taking and agenda setting. 

Communications and digital
Part of the working group leading the set up of the programme website; copywriting, editing and oversight of content creation for website.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
From June 2018 – April 2019, based in Moscow as an Alfa Fellow, part of the prestigious Alfa Fellowship Programme in which early- or mid- career professionals and emerging leaders from the UK, Germany and USA are supported to live, work and study in Moscow to further professional, cultural, economic and social links between Russia and the West. 

- Consultant to British Council on UK-Russia Year of Music 2019 (£1.5m cultural diplomacy programme), developing the programme evaluation framework including logic modelling and creation of outcomes framework in accordance with existing monitoring and evaluation requirements (REF)
- Advisor on cultural development for the Russian Arctic North: cultural development proposal for Russian NGO Сотрудничество (Sotrudnichestva), cultural centre ‘The Second School’ and Russian metals and mining company NorNickel, based on observation, interviews and desk-based research. Holistic proposal includes improvements to urban environment, local skills and broader tourism offer. Delivered training on project management and evaluation. 
- Project director of European digital music heritage and cultural diplomacy project (ongoing) conceived with the EUNIC Moscow cluster. Responsible for planning, delivery and communication and dissemination of a participatory digital music heritage project for Russian audiences.
- Research and writing about the creative industries in Russia, including interviewing local artists and sector specialists for website artygeneration.com and the Moscow Times.
profile_positions.title: Alfa Fellow 2018/19

profile_positions.description:
Working within the Collections Team and across the organisation with the task of better demonstrating the value of our activity and encouraging providers to provide the highest quality open cultural heritage content for reuse and for the best possible user experience. This includes:
*Supporting the development of the Rise of Literacy Generic Services project (managed externally) and working with the managing consortium, to launch two new thematic collections and approximately one year's editorial activity. Leading the launch of Europeana Manuscripts (link below).
*Working with a time-limited Task Force to support standardised training that can be delivered by Europeana, our aggregators, partners and network, focussing on the core messages and knowledge we need to share.
*Leading on the organisation of 'national workshops' for cultural heritage institutions to inform them of the value of providing (open) cultural heritage data online and to Europeana, and of the processes and frameworks to support them to do so. In collaboration with partners across Europe and multiple teams in Europeana. Oversaw the agenda setting, planning, debriefing, evaluation and follow up for workshops held in Finland, Lithuania, Bulgaria and Hungary, including leading the Lithuanian workshop.
*Joining the Impact team to support the development of case studies on how cultural heritage has an impact. This includes working on the next stage of development of the Impact Playbook, working on five case studies where the impact methodology was put in practice. 
*Considering how Europeana presents case studies about the value of our work and developing a format for better consistency and utility.
profile_positions.title: Collections Editor

profile_positions.description:
Europeana is a European commission-funded digital cultural heritage aggregation platform. Part of a small business development team supporting the re-use of Europeana content within priority markets of education and creative industries. Role requires:
•	Analysis and business planning for creative industries and education markets.
•	Articulating the value and impact of reuse of Europeana’s content to each market, leading on the creation of a business plan aiming to increase engagement in education sector. Contributing to the creation of a ‘Europeana4Education’ community, involving educators and other interested stakeholders (eg policy makers, commercial publishers, NGOs) in the educational and cultural heritage sectors.
•	Leading the planning and delivery of creative industry thematic reuse challenges which offer business investment to early stage prototypes. Includes planning and overseeing delivery of a communications plan targeting multiple audiences in the creative industries, cultural heritage and educational sectors. 
•	Identification of business opportunities, promotional opportunities and partnerships. Diverse commercial and non-commercial stakeholder management in multiple sectors. Diverse partnerships include the Year of Open and the Open Education Week, the World OER Map, educational NGOs and commercial publishers.
•	Developing resources for educators, including a guide to finding and using Europeana content and a guide to licenses/copyright for educational use. 
•	Cross-departmental working, including contributing to event or presentation planning and sitting on task- or project focused working groups.
•	Writing and delivering presentations at international invents, including workshops with educators and at meetings and conferences in Germany, Austria and Belgium.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Coordinator
